title.narrative: Supporting the nature to support people

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to raise awareness among Finns about the strong links between ecosystem services and the wellbeing of people with a focus on developing countries. We also want to broaden the public understanding of development co-operation and es pecially underline the importance of biological competence.The main result of the project is a series of artichles (in total 16 pages A4-size including text photos and information graphics) that will be published the magazine Finlands Natur in printing and on the webpage www.naturochmiljo.fi during the year 2015. The magazine has some 5000 regular readers and the outreach of the project can be extended by good PR via social media. The archive of artichles on the webbpage is used by e.g. schools.Even if we r each out to an existing audience we must ensure a high quality of the material. Therefore we will contract professional journalists to produce the material. Different aspects of Nature Restoration will be presented via specific examples from differens part s of the world. The voice of both local people and experts will be presented in the stories. The issues we want to cover in the artichles include:-Saving endangered species in co-operation with local communities (eg tigers in Himalaya orangs on Sumatra).-R estoring habitats such as Mangrove-forests or rivers.-Restoring nature as a part of post-conflict action (by UNEP).-Restoring nature (eg reforestation) with the aim of preserving and strengthening ecosystem service that are of crucial inportance to local c ommunities.-Mitigation of environmental disasters (e.g. chemical spills) that has affected freshwater reservoirs.
